meanings.definition: To put a new sole on (a shoe)
meanings.sent1: I need to resole my favorite shoes because the old soles are worn out.
meanings.sent2: The cobbler will resole my boots so they can last longer.
meanings.sent3: After my dog chewed on my shoes, I had to resole them to make them wearable again.
meanings.sent4: She decided to resole her relationship with her old friend by reaching out and apologizing.
meanings.sent5: The shoemaker's skillful hands can resole any shoe to look brand new.

meanings.definition: To provide with a new sole
meanings.sent1: The repair shop will resole my sandals with a sturdy new sole.
meanings.sent2: I asked the cobbler to resole my dress shoes with a non-slip sole.
meanings.sent3: The astronaut's boots were resoled with special material for walking on the moon.
meanings.sent4: The teacher wanted to resole the students with confidence before their big presentation.
meanings.sent5: The hiker's worn-out boots were resoled just in time for their next adventure.
